thread.title: Sooners senior WR Shepard hoping to make an impact in final Texas-OU game
thread.title_full: Sooners senior WR Shepard hoping to make an impact in final Texas-OU game | Dallas Morning News

author: Kate Hairopoulos
title: Sooners senior WR Shepard hoping to make an impact in final Texas-OU game
text:
Oklahoma senior receiver Sterling Shepard wouldn't mind, of course, leaving a lasting legacy in the Red River Showdown.
"I've only scored once against Texas -- last year on a wheel route," Shepard said this week. "I'd like to get something big. We'll see. I'll just let the game come to me and hope something happens."
Shepard again is the Sooners' top receiver, but OU and quarterback Baker Mayfield have been able to spread the ball around more in the first season of the Air Raid offense.
Shepard has 20 catches for 321 yards and three touchdowns, an average of 80.1 yards a game.
Dede Westbrook has 17 catches for 282 yards, and Durron Neal 14 for 260 yards. Running back Joe Mixon and tight end Mark Andrews have also been used as receiving targets.
Last season, Shepard had 51 catches for 970 yards, and more than 450 yards than Neal, who had the second-best receiving total.
"I wouldn't say I felt pressure [in 2014]," Shepard said. "I'm used to that, and I love getting the ball. I didn't feel pressure, but it's great to have other weapons with you."
